page.title: 18SHOPS IN BACKWELL
page.content: There are forty shops in Backwell.They are central,but over a mile from the furthest edges of the village.Many people use cars to go shopping.There are the normal village shops:_food, haberdashery,post office,D.I.Y.and also "Equicraft"selling equipment for horse_lovers. A lot of the villagers think there are not enough parking areas.There two parking places which are narrow and there is not much space to get in and out. The locals travel either to Bristol, Nailsea, Weston, this is to do the main shopping e.g. clothes or furniture. Bus and train services run to these towns. The station is very small and it costs about Â£1.10 return to Bristol.
